property.description: If selected code for parameter checking is included in the build.

constraint.display: Unique name required for each instance
Add at least one channel configuration
Calibration End Interrupt is required if any channel is configured in differential mode.
ELC signal source selection requires an ELC Driver

requires.display: Add Configuration for Channel 0 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 1 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 2 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 3 [Optional, only if used]
Add Configuration for Channel 4 [Optional, only if used]

property.description: Module name.

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: In single scan mode, all channels are converted once per start trigger, and conversion stops after all enabled channels are scanned. In continuous scan mode, conversion starts after a start trigger, then continues until stopped in software.
Select 24-bit or 16-bit resolution.
Select left or right alignment.

Select conversion start trigger. Conversion can be started in software, or conversion can be started when a hardware event occurs if the hardware event is linked to the SDADC peripheral using the ELC API.

linkConstraint.display: Requires an ELC peripheral function for SDADC

property.description: Vref can be source internally and output on the SBIAS pin, or Vref can be input from VREFI.
Select Vref voltage. If Vref is input externally, the voltage on VREFI must match the voltage selected within 3%.
Enter the name of the callback function to be called when conversion completes or a scan ends.

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: [Required] Select the interrupt priority for the conversion end interrupt.
[Optional] Select the interrupt priority for the scan end interrupt.
[Optional] Select the interrupt priority for the calibration end interrupt.

module.macros: /* Macro to tie dynamic ELC link to ADC_TRIGGER_SYNC_ELC option in adc_trigger_t. */ #define ADC_TRIGGER_SDADC0 ADC_TRIGGER_SYNC_ELC
module.declarations: sdadc_instance_ctrl_t ${module.driver.adc.name}_ctrl; const sdadc_extended_cfg_t ${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg_extend = { #if defined(VECTOR_NUMBER_SDADC0_ADI) .conv_end_irq = VECTOR_NUMBER_SDADC0_ADI, #else .conv_end_irq = FSP_INVALID_VECTOR, #endif .conv_end_ipl = ${module.driver.adc.conversion_end_ipl}, .vref_src = ${module.driver.adc.vref_src}, .vref_voltage = ${module.driver.adc.vref_voltage}, #define RA_NOT_DEFINED (0xFFFFFFFF) #if (RA_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel0::module.driver.adc.channel}) #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_0 (0) .p_channel_cfgs[0] = NULL, #else #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_0 (1U << 0) .p_channel_cfgs[0] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg0, #endif #if (RA_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel1::module.driver.adc.channel}) #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_1 (0) .p_channel_cfgs[1] = NULL, #else #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_1 (1U << 1) .p_channel_cfgs[1] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg1, #endif #if (RA_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel2::module.driver.adc.channel}) #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_2 (0) .p_channel_cfgs[2] = NULL, #else #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_2 (1U << 2) .p_channel_cfgs[2] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg2, #endif #if (RA_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel3::module.driver.adc.channel}) #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_3 (0) .p_channel_cfgs[3] = NULL, #else #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_3 (1U << 3) .p_channel_cfgs[3] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg3, #endif #if (RA_NOT_DEFINED == ${module.driver.sdadc.requires.channel4::module.driver.adc.channel}) #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_4 (0) .p_channel_cfgs[4] = NULL, #else #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_4 (1U << 4) .p_channel_cfgs[4] = &g_sdadc_channel_cfg4, #endif #undef RA_NOT_DEFINED }; #define SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK (SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_0 | SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_1 | SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_2 | SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_3 | SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK_4) const adc_cfg_t ${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg = { .unit = ${module.driver.adc.unit}, .mode = ${module.driver.adc.mode}, .resolution = ${module.driver.adc.resolution}, .alignment = ${module.driver.adc.alignment}, .trigger = ADC_TRIGGER_${module.driver.adc.trigger}, #if defined(VECTOR_NUMBER_SDADC0_SCANEND) .scan_end_irq = VECTOR_NUMBER_SDADC0_SCANEND, #else .scan_end_irq = FSP_INVALID_VECTOR, #endif .scan_end_ipl = ${module.driver.adc.scan_end_ipl}, #if defined(VECTOR_NUMBER_SDADC0_CALIEND) .scan_end_b_irq = VECTOR_NUMBER_SDADC0_CALIEND, #else .scan_end_b_irq = FSP_INVALID_VECTOR, #endif .scan_end_b_ipl = ${module.driver.adc.calibration_end_ipl}, .p_callback = ${module.driver.adc.p_callback}, .p_context = NULL, .p_extend = &${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg_extend, }; const sdadc_scan_cfg_t ${module.driver.adc.name}_channel_cfg = { .scan_mask = SDADC_CHANNEL_MASK, }; /* Instance structure to use this module. */ const adc_instance_t ${module.driver.adc.name} = { .p_ctrl = &${module.driver.adc.name}_ctrl, .p_cfg = &${module.driver.adc.name}_cfg, .p_channel_cfg = &${module.driver.adc.name}_channel_cfg, .p_api = &g_adc_on_sdadc };

constraint.display: For Single-Ended Input, Stage 1 Gain must be 1
For Single-Ended Input, Stage 2 Gain must be 1
For Single-Ended Input, Oversampling must be 256

property.description: Specify the channel.
Select differential or single-ended input.
Select the gain for stage 1 of the PGA. Must be 1 for single-ended input.
Select the gain for stage 2 of the PGA. Must be 1 for single-ended input.
Select the oversampling ratio for the PGA. Must be 256 for single-ended input.
Select positive or negative polarity for single-ended input. VBIAS (1.0 V typical) is connected on the opposite input.
Select the number of conversions to average for each result. The ADC_EVENT_CONVERSION_END event occurs after each average, or after each individual conversion if averaging is disabled.

option.display: Do Not Average (Interrupt after Each Conversion)

property.display: Invert (Valid for Negative Single-Ended Input Only)
property.description: Select whether to invert negative single-ended input. When the result is inverted, the lowest measurable voltage gives a result of 0, and the highest measurable voltage gives a result of 2^resolution - 1.
Number of conversions on this channel before AUTOSCAN moves to the next channel. When all conversions of all channels are complete, the ADC_EVENT_SCAN_END event occurs.
